clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Pediatric Drugs in Nasal Congestion
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Evaluation of Safety and Efficacy of Pediatric Naridrin in Comparison to Afrin on the Improval of Nasal Congestion.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy of the Naridrin in improving nasal congestion.

detailed_description.textblock: Open label, randomized, multicenter clinical study. Maximal experiment duration: 2 days; 2 visits. Safety and efficacy evaluation

primary_outcome.description: Relief of nasal congestion will be measured on a scale of 0 to 3 (0 = without congestion and 3 total congestion)

secondary_outcome.description: Safety of the drug will be assessed by observation of adverse events monitored for the type, frequency and intensity during the days of the follow-up. The evaluation of the heart frequency will also be a safety parameter.

arm_group.description: Naridrin: 2 drops in each nostril once daily as prescription
2 pumps in each nostril every 12 hours

intervention.description: Naridrin® : 2 drops in each nostril once daily as prescription
2 pumps in each nostril every 12 hours.
